question.body: Which is not a function of hair in humans?

multiple_choice.choice: helps keep harmful particles out of the body
protection from the sun's UV radiation
major mechanism to maintain body warmth

response.feedback: Incorrect. Nerves are present in the dermis associated with hair follicles, which alert us to insects on our skin.
Incorrect. The hairs in the nose can filter out harmful particles.
Incorrect. The hair on your head protects the scalp, which is exposed to the most sun at the top of the body.
Correct. This maybe true for animals, but most people donâ€™t have sufficient hair to maintain warmth.

part.hint: Consider how much hair you have covering your body compared to how much hair a dog has.
